front.title: July 4, 2010 Problem Statement for Cross-Layer Optimization

abstract.t: Due to the lack of layer interaction between networked applications and the network during service provisioning, many application services can make poor use of network resources or not achieve their overall quality of service objectives. This document describes the general problem of cross layer optimization. Cross-layer optimization (CLO) involves the overall optimization of application layer and network resources by providing an interface for interactions and exchanges between the two layers. The potential gains of cross layer optimization are illustrated via examples from content delivery systems, video on demand systems, and grid computing.
